probably not
read 'man sudoers'
search for timeout
what are you trying to do?
I believe you need to run visudo and add 'Parameter ::= timestamp_timeout '=' minutes'
sudo -v will extend the timeout...by 15 min. default.
you could add yourself to the group 'disk'
that would be a security problem though, you'd be able to e.g. zero-write your disks accidently.
exactly.
you could also add to /etc/sudoers:   libben root = NOPASSWD: /usr/bin/hddtemp
the above-suggested method seems the best to me.
yep...
add the line above.
assuming your user account is libben
use 'VISUAL=nano visudo'
to make sure that you don't make a syntax-error that stops you from using sudo after you save the file. :-D
